table_description: AWS Route53 Resolver Query Logging Configuration

columns.name: id
columns.description: The ID for the query logging configuration.

columns.name: name
columns.description: The name of the query logging configuration.

columns.name: arn
columns.description: The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) for the query logging configuration.

columns.name: creation_time
columns.description: The date and time that the query logging configuration was created, in Unix time format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

columns.name: status
columns.description: The status of the specified query logging configuration. Valid values include CREATING|CREATED|DELETING|FAILED.

columns.name: association_count
columns.description: The number of VPCs that are associated with the query logging configuration.

columns.name: ip_address_count
columns.description: The number of IP addresses that you have associated with the Resolver endpoint.

columns.name: creator_request_id
columns.description: A unique string that identifies the request that created the query logging configuration.

columns.name: destination_arn
columns.description: The ARN of the resource that you want Resolver to send query logs: an Amazon S3 bucket, a CloudWatch Logs log group, or a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream.

columns.name: owner_id
columns.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID for the account that created the query logging configuration.

columns.name: share_status
columns.description: An indication of whether the query logging configuration is shared with other Amazon Web Services accounts, or was shared with the current account by another Amazon Web Services account. Sharing is configured through Resource Access Manager (RAM).
